line_1: See! how Pride thy Heart inclines
line_2: To think, for Thee that Shepherd pines;

line_1: And deems it shame, if he to peace inclines;
line_2: Mindless of food, he, dreary caitiff! pines;

line_1: And deems it shame, if he to peace inclines;
line_2: But to the wind all merriment resigns;

line_1: And deems it shame, if he to peace inclines;
line_2: Which for his dame's annoyance he designs;

line_1: To him whose willing heart inclines
You thought perhaps, as Giddy Youth inclines,
line_2: Imprudently to value all that Shines,

line_1: Now to the left her ivory neck inclines,
line_2: And leads in Paphian curves its azure lines;

line_1: (Tho' to no pompous Sound the Ear inclines,
line_2: While the mean Sense is propt by stronger Lines)

line_1: When the sun less intense to the westward inclines,
line_2: And see the rays dance as inverted he shines,
